messages.title: Carry a knife... go to jail
messages.content: Assault victim Margaret Murdoch from Dunfermline says it's time that the justice system got tougher on knife crime. Margaret is backing Labour's fight to see over 25,000 knife crimes end under Labour's plans.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Iain wants a zero-tolerance approach on fireworks, with specialist teachers back in the classrooms. Schools should focus on the basics, and if elected, he will not allow his party to bring back the tuition fees.

Youth unemployment is a critical point now. Iain wants to bring in apprenticeships for school leavers and is planning to introduce a scheme to give 10,000 unemployed youngsters the chance of a real job.
Labour will make sure you don't pay the price for Tory mistakes. Under a future Labour government, the cost of household bills will be reduced.

issues.education: Zero tolerance approach on fireworks, specialist teachers back in classrooms, focus on basics, and no tuition fees.

endorsements.endorsement: Margaret is backing Labour's fight to see over 25,000 knife crimes end under Labour's plans.

quotes.text: People are fed up with criminals getting let off lightly when there is strong evidence against them... They should be much tougher on those carrying the vulnerable and are willing to pay for someone to be prepared to use it. These people are potential killers.

images.caption: Iain Gray and John Park having a discussion.
